page.title: 01GENERAL LAND USE,ROXWELL
page.content: Our area is mostly farmland with crops growing in most of the fields. {Corn}is grown mostly. There are three kinds of{wheat}_ Rapier, Fenman and Aquila. Other crops that are grown are {oats and barley.} The earth under our area is very heavy.There is a top soil then underneath that is clay with bits of flint mixed in. We get quite a lot of floods because clay can't take in water. Under that is sand which is used for making roads and finally under that is chalk. There are lots of streams running through Roxwell. At Newland hall there are some lakes and lots of people go to fish there,the fish that are in the lakes are mostly trout. A few fields in our area are used for keeping cattle which eat one and a half tons of mixed food a year.
